description: Minimal number of steps to get from 0 to n by (a) adding 1 or (b) multiplying by 2.
comments: A stopping problem: begin with n and at each stage if even divide by 2 or if odd subtract 1. That is, iterate A029578 while nonzero.From _Peter Kagey_, Jul 16 2015: (Start)The number of appearances of n in this sequence is identically A000045(n). Proof:By application of the formula,"a(0) = 0, a(2n+1) = a(2n) + 1 and a(2n) = a(n) + 1",it can be seen that:{i: a(i) = n} = {2*i: a(i) = n-1, n>0} U {2*i+1: a(i)=n-2, n>1}.Because the two sets on the left hand side share no elements:|{i: a(i) = n}| = |{i: a(i) = n-1, n>0}| + |{i: a(i) = n-2, n>1}|Notice that|{i : a(i) = 1}| = |{1}| = 1 = A000045(1) and|{i : a(i) = 2}| = |{2}| = 1 = A000045(2).Therefore the number of appearances of n in this sequence is A000045(n).(End)
